entries.title: Why BMW decided to manufacture batteries in the US
entries.description: BMW recently announced a $1.7 billion investment to help prepare its huge Spartanburg, South Carolina, factory to produce electric cars and SUVs. That sum included $700 million for the construction of a battery manufacturing plant nearby.

entries.title: Elon Musk didn't want EV tax credits. Now Tesla is warming up to them
entries.description: Tesla buyers may be able to take advantage of new federal tax credits for electric vehicles next year, the automaker's executives said Wednesday. The credits can be as large as $7,500 for new vehicles and $4,000 for used vehicles.

entries.title: Bezos and fellow billionaires are issuing recession warnings
entries.description: Even the uber-rich are on edge now about the economy.

entries.title: Inflation has people living paycheck to paycheck. Here's how some banks are responding
entries.description: "Payday Friday" may soon be replaced by "Payday Wednesday."

entries.title: Analysis: Under Xi Jinping, zero-Covid is accelerating China's surveillance state
entries.description: As a new, deadly virus overtook the central city of Wuhan and spread throughout China in early 2020, the country's ruling Communist Party and its leader Xi Jinping were faced with a crisis on a scale not seen in decades.

entries.title: Indonesia bans sale of all cough syrups after 99 child deaths
entries.description: Indonesia has halted the sale of all syrup and liquid medicines following the deaths of nearly 100 children and an unexplained spike in cases of acute kidney injuries.

entries.title: Chinese stocks tumble to multi-year lows in New York and Hong Kong amid party congress
entries.description: Chinese stocks have hit multi-year lows in New York and Hong Kong amid growing concerns about China's rising Covid cases and economic outlook.

entries.title: Eight killed as parcel bombs and gunfire rock Myanmar's biggest jail
entries.description: Bombs inside parcels exploded at Myanmar's biggest jail on Wednesday prompting soldiers to return fire in a confrontation in which at least eight people were killed, state media and a witness said.

entries.title: Twitterverse vigilance scares LVMH CEO into dumping his private plane
entries.description: Billionaires are no match for the Twitterverse.
